subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: The Islanders agreed to terms with forwards Sean Bergenheim and Jeff Tambellini on two-year deals. Bergenheim’s deal is worth $1.725 million and Tambellini’s $1.175 million. Last season, Bergenheim played in 78 games with the Islanders and posted 10 goals and 12 assists. Tambellini, 24, led the Islanders’ Bridgeport affiliate with 38 goals and 38 assists in 57 games. His 76 points set a franchise record. He had a goal and three assists in 31 games with the Islanders.
